intro: Eupatorium fortunei var. angustilobum, commonly known as narrow-leaved boneset, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers in clusters, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and showy inflorescences make it a notable species in ecological and botanical studies.
